verses.verse: Now on the first [day] of the week, very early in the morning, they came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared and certain [other things] with them,
and found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
They entered but didn't find the body of the Lord Jesus.
Then it came about, as they were perplexed about it, behold, two men in shining garments stood by them.
They were afraid and bowed down their faces to the ground, they said to them, "Why do you seek the living among the dead?
"He is not here but is risen. Don't you remember how he spoke to you when he was yet in Galilee,
saying, «The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, be crucified, and on the third day rise.»
Then they remembered his words, [9] and returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven and all the rest.
It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and other [women] with them that told these things to the Apostles.
Yet their words seems like nonsense to them, and they didn't believe them.
Then Peter got up and ran to the tomb; stooping down he saw the linen clothes laid by themselves, then he left wondering in himself what was going to happen.
And behold, two of them went that same day to a village name Emmaus, which was about 7 miles from Jerusalem.
They talked together about all the things which had happened.
It so happened that while they were talking and thinking about this, Jesus came near and went with them,
but their eyes were held back from recognizing him.
He said to them, "What kind of things are you discussing with each other as you walk and are sad?"
One of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said to him, "Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem and haven't known the things that have happened there these [past few] days?"
He said to them, "What things?" They said to him, "Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people.
"And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death and have crucified him.
"But we were hoping that it would have been he who was going to save Israel, and beside all this, today, is the third day since these things happened.
"Yes, and certain women also of our group, who were early at the tomb, astonished us,
when they didn't find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.
"And certain of those, who are with us, went to the tomb and found it just like the women had said, but they didn't see him."
Then he said to the, "O fools and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken,
shouldn't Christ have to suffer these things, and then enter into his glory?"
Then beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.
They came closer to the village where they were going, and he made as though he would have gone further,
but they held him back saying, "Stay with us, for it is almost evening, and the day is almost gone." Then he went in to stay with them.
Then it happened as he sat to eat with them, he took bread, blessed it, broke it, and gave to them.
Then their eyes were opened; they recognized him, but he vanished out of their sight.
Then they said to one another, "Didn't our hear burn within us, while he talked with us on the way, and while he opened to us the Scriptures?"
They got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem, found the eleven gathered together along with those who were with them,
saying, "The Lord is risen indeed and has appeared to Simon."
Then they told what things [happened] to them on the road, and how he was recognized by them when breaking the bread.
And as they spoke about this, Jesus himself stood in their midst and said to them, "Peace be to you."
But they were very scared and terrified, and figured that they had seen a ghost.
But he said them, "Why are you troubled? Why do such thoughts rise up in your hearts?
"Look at my hands and my feet, that it is I myself. Touch me and see, for a ghost doesn't have flesh and bones as you see me have."
After he had spoken this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
And while they still didn't believe because of joy and wonder, he said to them, "Do you have any food?"
Then they gave him a piece of broiled fish and a honeycomb.
He took it and ate it in front of them.

Then he said to them, "These are the worlds which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that everything must be fulfilled which were written in the law of Moses and in the prophets and in the psalms concerning me."
Then he opened their understanding, so they could understand the Scriptures,
and said to them, "It thus is written and necessary for Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead on the third day,
and that repentance and remission of sins should be preach in his name among all nations starting at Jerusalem.
"You are witnesses of these things.
"Now look, I send the promise of my Father to you, but remain in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high."
Then he led them out as far as to Bethany and lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
Then it came to pass while he blessed them, that he was parted from then and carried up into heaven.
They worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
and were continually in the Temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
